entry.title: Humanitarian crisis in Karabakh worsens, Azerbaijan continues region‚Äôs blockade for 8th day

media:group.media:title: Humanitarian crisis in Karabakh worsens, Azerbaijan continues region‚Äôs blockade for 8th day
media:group.media:description:
For the 8th consecutive day, a group of Azerbaijanis posing as so-called environmentalists continue blockade the Lachin corridor, which is the only road connecting Karabakh to Armenia and thus, to the outside world.
Accompanied by convoys of the International Committee of the Red Cross and Russian peacekeepers, it was possible to transport one patient from Artsakh to Armenia for heart surgery on Monday. Medical operations are still suspended in Artsakh; medicine and food are not being supplied either.

entry.title: ‚ÄòAn essential service‚Äô: Armenia‚Äôs Women‚Äôs Support Center works to respond to domestic violence

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄòAn essential service‚Äô: Armenia‚Äôs Women‚Äôs Support Center works to respond to domestic violence
media:group.media:description:
Ani Jilozian is the director of development at the Women‚Äôs Support Center, Armenia‚Äôs leading organization working to respond to and prevent domestic and intimate partner violence. Ani sat down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to discuss the Women‚Äôs Support Center‚Äôs work, proposed changes to Armenia‚Äôs domestic violence laws, and the Istanbul Convention, a Council of Europe human rights treaty that Armenia has signed but not yet ratified.
The Women‚Äôs Support Center‚Äôs hotline is 099 88 78 08. You can donate to the organization‚Äôs annual crowdfunding campaign here.
0:00 Breaking the stigma of talking about domestic violence in Armenia 1:59 What is parliament planning to do to improve Armenia‚Äôs domestic violence laws? 4:12 Why should Armenia ratify the Istanbul Convention? 5:37 The importance of setting up domestic violence shelters 8:47 Future plans for the Women‚Äôs Support Center

*’è’•’Ω’°’∂’µ’∏÷Ç’©’® ’∫’°’ø÷Ä’°’Ω’ø’æ’•’¨ ’ß ’£’∏÷Ä’Æ’®’∂’Ø’•÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂ ’∑÷Ä’ª’°’∂’°’Ø’∏÷Ç’¥
Kasa Foundation developed quests thanks to which you can discover Shirak region; culture, history, people. The quests invite participants to tackle different challenges and think outside the box to search for clues and uncover answers in the game. They are intended for children ages 10 and up, including teenagers and adults.

entry.title: Armenians across the world have a role to play to help Artsakh

media:group.media:title: Armenians across the world have a role to play to help Artsakh
media:group.media:description:
State Minister of Artsakh, Ruben Vardanyan, speaks to CivilNet‚Äôs Emilio Cricchio about the recent blockade of the only route between Armenia and Artsakh, and how this is causing a humanitarian crisis for the Armenians of Artsakh. Mr. Vardanyan also discusses what Armenians around the world can do to assist the people of Artsakh.
